item.title: Simulation View of Causality
item.description: Wherein I try to present and intuitive account of causal reasoning and the important notion of the do-operator while avoiding some of the complexities of the do-calculus, d-separation and the like. Imagine that we have a model of a physical phenomenon whose attributes of interest are \(X\) and \(Y\). For example \(X\) could be temperature of mixture of gases and \(Y\) could be rate of a chemical reaction between the gases.
